A hacker is an individual who possesses advanced skills in computer programming and has the ability to gain unauthorized access to computer systems or networks. These individuals often use their skills and knowledge to breach security measures and obtain sensitive information or cause harm to digital infrastructures. Hackers can be categorized into different types, such as black-hat hackers who engage in malicious activities for personal gain or to disrupt operations, and white-hat hackers who use their skills ethically to identify and fix vulnerabilities in systems. The motives behind hacking can vary, ranging from financial gain to political activism or personal satisfaction. Hackers play a crucial role in the cybersecurity landscape, exposing weaknesses and prompting organizations to enhance their defenses against potential threats
